main.name: Teemu Sormunen
main.description: Exploring the latest machine learning trends
main.bio: I'm a third year Master's degree student at Aalto University. I enjoy challenging myself with thought experiments, as well as with real life coding challenges. I enjoy spending my free time reading about latest advancements in machine learning and neuroscience. If I'm not busy working on my side-projects, you can find me enjoying the outdoors or playing the guitar.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

education.degree: Masters programme in Machine Learning, Data Science and Artificial Intelligence
education.description: Bayesian data analysis, deep learning, kernel methods, natural language processing
Was at Mexico for exchange studies. Took courses in marketing, data-driven business decision and managerial skills.

education.degree: Bachelor of engineering in automation engineering - intelligent machines and devices
education.description: Electrical and automation engineering basic studies. Additional courses and skills in computer vision, autonomous robotics and machine learning.
Was at Czech Republic for exchange studies. Took courses in programming, robotics and UI/UX design.

work.title: Data Science Trainee
work.description: Worked with data science projects during the exploration phase, implementation phase and the productisation phase. Projects in computer vision and NLP. Programming language: Python.

work.title: Mobile Developer Trainee
work.description: Mobile development for native Android and iOS. Worked with Kotlin and Swift. Also got familiarity in using Git, CI/CD pipelines and Linux.

work.title: Sales Support Trainee
work.description: Worked on daily tasks in lifecycle services. Tasks included creating reports with business intelligence and programming with Configure, Price, Quote (CPQ) -tool. Also worked with spare parts, and maintenance reports and tasklists.

projects.body: Built a bot that searches for free saunas automatically, and reports results to Telegram.
projects.solution: Each resident gets 5 resevations per month. Sauna slots that are still vacant after 15 minutes from the start of the slot can be booked without losing reservation count. Being a Sauna-lover, I Used Selenium to login and scrape sauna slots from resident sauna calendar and log them to Telegram channel. This makes sure I never miss free Sauna slots!

achievements.body: Loop Q Prize 2021 is a machine learning competition for European university students. It's goal is to get students to discover the field of cognitive computing. The challenge was to create ML models and analyse facial expressions from images.
achievements.solution: It's known that CNN's are able to extract meaningful features from images, and my interest was to see whether manual feature extraction could provide comparable results. I also compared whether CNN detects the same patterns as in Facial Action Coding System (FACS).

achievements.body: Psyhack gathers psychology professionals, students and people with problem solving -mindset to solve challenges in the area of psychology. In 2020-edition the goal was to explore how smart technology could be used a mental health promoter, and how it can reduce mental health problems.
achievements.solution: Our team consisted of two psychology students and me. We proposed a mobile application 'UniMind' to support University student mental wellbeing. The application proposal included a guided training program which consisted of small modules, helping student to build a toolkit for healthier studying habits.

achievements.body: Tampereen Insinöörit ry chooses yearly the best engineering thesis from Tampere University of Applied Sciences. I won the best engineering thesis award of 2020.
achievements.solution: In my thesis I explored 'Visual autonomous navigation in forest environment'. The goal was introduce reader to classical navigation stack used in autonomous vehicles, and as well to explore what research has been conducted regarding to visual-based navigation in forest environment. The thesis focused strognly on different simultaneous localization and mapping (SLAM) approaches. I also introduced results from a self-made RC-car that was capable of mapping environment and performing route calculations.
